<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 808, 574]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(10 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10 \text{m/s}^2\)).

<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
Fig. 1.1 shows sea water flowing down a channel into a tank without splashing. The water is flowing at a rate of \(800 \text{kg} /\text{min}\). The length and width of the tank are \(3.10 \text{m}\) and \(1.20 \text{m}\). The density of the sea water is \(1020 \text{kg} /\text{m}^3\).

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[173, 128, 816, 336]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 352, 591, 371]]<|/det|>
Fig. 1.1 (not to scale)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 384, 146, 402]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 384, 369, 402]]<|/det|>
Initially, the tank is empty.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 415, 920, 448]]<|/det|>
Calculate the depth of water in the tank after 1.00 minute. Give your answer to three significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[517, 553, 920, 572]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 616, 828, 634]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[225, 708, 920, 727]]<|/det|>
<form>decrease in gravitational potential energy = .................................................... [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 771, 692, 789]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[490, 895, 920, 913]]<|/det|>
